title: I think twich poison could actually use a little buff.
body:
Really, 2-6 true damage per stack per second is nto that much at all. Sure it does help but, at that rarely over 100 ish true damage mid game, and like 200 at top endgame. 200 true damage on 3000 hp tank is peanut. compare to auto attack and contaminate proc, that like what? under 10% of your dps? Even corki bonus true damage on attack seem more significent as a passive

But as twich dont really have much other damage on his kit other than Contaminate. i think it would not hurt at all to actually boost the poison damage. Especially to make it mire potent toward endgame.

Maybe just make it scaling on AD or add a % hp value to make him a bit better of a tank melter. twich not that bad, but like a lot of adc right now, he need some buff to keep up with the kalista, grave and jinx of this world.

replies.body: The problem with buffing his poison damage is that it scales exponentially. The buff from 1 true damage to 2 true damage actually increased his poison damage by 72 at 6 stacks. So even an increase from 2 to 4 could cause twitch to deal 200-300 more true damage. Hence, why riot doesn't want to increase the damage on it.

but realistically...that 200-300 damage  _**OVER 6 SECOND**_....6 second is LONG

in 6 second in a fight people have the time to die 10 time from pretty much any other source. Could buff poison 3 time more and suport/adc/mage would still die from 3-5 AA and a contamine before poison really make any real difference.


only poeple who will actualyl FEEL the poison increase might be TANK and FLEEING ennemy who might end up dying from poison after retreating with 200 hp.

that might also make him a ltitle more bully in lane due to ability to deal more damage from small  slow / 1-2 attack trade, but he need that so.
The only problem with this is that it can affect 5 people easily. Corki's cannot.

Well, people argue that to counter some champions you have to build x item. And while I never agree with that statement, if other champions can have that, why can't twitch? Build {{item:3140}} and you can remove it, done. Realistically though, late game, if you took enough stacks to get the full damage as a squishy, you're probably already dead. ADC's only tend to have about 2k health max.  6 autos surpasses that pretty quickly. 

Besides, you forget that Twitch has no other damage other than his Autos, there are no skill shots or procs aside from his E. It's just all autos, which means if the enemy builds a Thorn mail they're pretty much damaging you already. Even with life steal you're going to take some damage.

Tanks won't just be completely shredded by this anyways. 300 true damage isn't going to do a lot to a tank anyways, over 6 seconds. Not when there are health items like {{item:3709}} It pretty much gives you enough and more to negate that true damage. Besides, there's always {{item:3022}} and {{item:3083}} If you really want to negate that true damage :/

See, it's riddled with counter play, even for the ones it's intended to hurt.

His venom cask or whatever also applies stacks aoe, why are you forgetting this?
True damage hurts tanks the most, and 300 damage is easily the difference between life and death on a tank. True damage is never negated, only dampened and building flat hp makes tanks vulnerable to botrk (which is on like every duelist) and liandrys and any % damage anyone has.

We're assuming this is against a Tank who has 3.5-4+k Health already. At 6 full stacks, twitch will deal 486 True damage over 6 seconds. This being at level 18. That's only 1/10th of a Tanks full health if he was smart and now has 4k+ health. Which is easily attainable.

Now, using the active on his E will only do (With Dragon buff and full build) 174 per stack, or 183 attack damage if your ult is active. That's 1098 on proc if the enemy has 0% armor.  Even calculating a Last Whisper and masteries (the Tank should have least 75% armor) they remain with 35% armor. Reducing the damage on the active to 713 Attack damage. That's inconsequential considering this can only be done once every 8 seconds.

Now, is only if you built Damage on Twitch and got the first Dragon. {{item:3153}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3035}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3031}} For a total of 391 ATK and 1.88 ATK speed calculating scaling and Runes/Masteries typical for an Auto dependent ADC. This only spiking to 427 ATK when your Ult is active. So at best your autos are doing 277.55 or 192 if they built Ninja Tabi. Again, this is NOTHING for a tank.

So, let me clarify. A fully built Twitch will only deal  486 True damage, Over 6 seconds. 713 for a full proc on his E, which he can't do again for another 8 seconds. And a potential 4 Autos for 1108 or 768 damage. 

Best Scenario: 2307
Worst: 1967
Even so 486 of this would not be calculated in the burst, as it would be sustained damage. 

But with all this, it's only speculating that the tank actually lets you get your full stacks on him, and then you can survive long enough to proc the active. You also have to remain still while you do this, in order to get this out as fast as possible. Meaning you're going ALL IN on the tank. 

Most of the time you won't. You'll only get 3-4 stacks in there, and 2 on everyone else. Which again, is nothing. And your Ult does reduced damage for every enemy it passes. 

When you compare this to someone who does the same thing, but can stack INFINITELY and do more damage per stack, while remaining mobile and dealing CC when activating, yes Twitch could use a buff.

If you want to calculate a full team battle. Then twitch will more than likely not get this full damage out. Why? Because he'll be focused on by the team being the carry. And thus will die in about 1-2 seconds from a huge burst, given he has no mobility or escape. Its only in the best conditions that he can do that full 2307 damage, and that's late game at full build with the dragon buff.

Really, this is dwarfed by the burst of other ADC's with Health% Damage and greater Cast Damage. 

The only thing Twitch has going for him are: Stealth and Atk range. His damage is really no issue unless the enemy just lets you attack them. But that's the case with virtually EVERY champion.

You didn't take into account a single crit at all with two crit items.  You STILL did not take into account the cask either nor the fact that **twitch can auto multiple people at once, reduced damage or not**. His actual best case scenario would mean he deals over 8k damage if he hits 5 people. 

How is 1/2 of a tank inconsequential? Who has infinitely stacking true damage? 

I would like to see your math about the auto damage, because i'm certain you didn't take into account botrk, and I don't get how tabi's can shave 75 damage off unless you have 750 on hit damage. If a tank has 35% armor and tabis, then 427 would deal 234.85, not 192.

You are downplaying the value of stealth (which gives a large as bonus too) and the highest of all ranges in game, higher than that of even turrets.

Landing a 5 man stack is near impossible in a group fight. I seriously doubt you've ever even touched Twitch if you don't know this. Only a group of idiots would group together enough for not only his W to hit them all, which applies only 2 stacks and a small slow, and no other damage, but to allow all of twitch's Autos to hit them all. They'd have to be standing in a straight line behind the tank. 

So your point is invalidated. 

Even if you were to land a crit, it would do a total of 1067.5 before defenses. 35% Reduction and 10% Stacking Ninja Tabi for a total of 45% reduction on auto attack damage. That's a 586.625 Auto. But again, this is Inconsequential. 

Compared to other abilities that can not only Crit, but do more scaling damage than an Auto, yes this is nothing. But that's getting off topic. If you're going to "QQ I'm a tank. A burst actually hurt me. I can't just stand there and take 0 damage" then you're completely missing the point.

Twitch is an ASSASSIN, so of course he has some level of damage. But this damage is only Single Target. Only 1 person is really every going to take your full brunt. Which means once it's done, it's done. Not only that, unlike other assassins, you don't juke around while bursting. You have to stay relatively still to land Autos and proc W and E. 

So if your point is that it does a lot, and Twitch gets his Prime, no one is even trying to stop him. Yes he's going to hurt. But that's your fault for letting him get there. For not trying to even cc him, just standing there letting him hit you, and then allowing him to go those 2-3 seconds in which he's setting everything up, untouched. Which again, invalidates your point.

ANy number of champions can deal more damage than twitch in their burst, which takes less, if you just let them.

As a Talon main I can near kill a Tank with my full rotation if he's stupid enough to let me get it all out.

"best case" means everything is in line, realistic or not. He'll still tend to hit two or three so he'll ~~**_merely_**~~ deal 5k. 

I find it boggling how 1/8th a tank is inconsequential when it means you're like three shotting squishies. Tanks are actually supposed to survive more than 2 seconds you know. There are like 3-4 abilities that can crit and apply on hits, i can think of only 2 right now. AA modifiers don't really count.

If twitch is really assassin, why is his primary marksman and he's never played top or mid? Why is he always bot (or jungle sometimes) and plays like an adc? Calling twitch single target with piercing autos and an aoe spell is like calling lux single target.  Technically, lux will only deal full damage to one person and she has an aoe spell and a piercing ult, similar to twitch.

You realize you shouldn't really be proccing your expunge to hurt, but to get that kill when they get out of your 850 range? 

>So if your point is that it does a lot, and Twitch gets his Prime, no one is even trying to stop him. Yes he's going to hurt. But that's your fault for letting him get there. For not trying to even cc him, just standing there letting him hit you, and then allowing him to go those 2-3 seconds in which he's setting everything up, untouched. Which again, invalidates your point.

Where did I say this? You never addressed any of my points and claim they are invalidated. You did your math wrong and simply won't own up to it. You answered none of my questions posed either.

Are you seriously saying that any champion will deal more damage than twitch (who deals sustained damage by the way, not burst, auto's are not burst damage)? I could give you a massive list of champs that twitch outdamages given two seconds.
This ignores regen. Maybe change the way the passive scales then?
I agree with this buffing his poison would not be a very wise decision in the near future.
It was fine before then got a small buff. It is even more fine now.

The problem is than...right now fine is NOT enought to challenge other adc.

it need to be GOOD :P

I don't know where you are getting information from, but it wasn't that long ago Twitch was a top tier adc being picked constantly. 

Late game twitch can still pave over entire teams, his passive scales to insane heights late game, it isn't meant to be good early on.


Twitch's basic attacks apply a stack of Poison icon Deadly Venom, dealing 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 / 6 true damage per second for 6 seconds. This effect can stack up to 6 times for a minimum of 12 / 18 / 24 / 30 / 36 and maximum of 72 / 108 / 144 / 180 / 216 total true damage over the duration.

You argue that 200 true damage over 6 seconds isn't much but you do know that it keeps reapplying and the damage continues until 6 seconds pass of that target not getting hit.

his passive scale insane heights lategame???????? 

Even if you count re-aplying, that still only 36 damage per second max lategame.

at this point of the game:

- tank can get 3K + hp on average.
- Just average adc auto get around 250-300 damage with roundly 1 attack a second (not coutning crits)
- mage get 1k+ magic damage brust easy

not to mention you had to attack a WHOLE 6 TIME before even getting to that MISERABLE 36 damage per second.


Compare to pretty much everythings, 36 damage a second is basically  IRREVELENT at this point.



He can own team lategame caus he goe AOE damage passive. his AA alone does the damage, poison is basically just for the look....


That why his passive need better damage...to me more revelent in laning a little, and actually make a small difference again tank. right now, his poison basically tickle, nothings more.

As the other guy mentioned this can be applied to multiple people from long range, along with a {{item:3085}} that true damage is devastating. 

I feel like you underestimate how good true damage is.

underestimate how good poison damage is?

6 true damage oer second per stack. now let say they start at 2 casu you landed the slow rigth away. then you attack then at aroudn one attack a second. cosidering is take 4 extra attack to even reach 36 damaeg epr second. after like 6 secodn you deal like 192 true damage total...

not much at all....

Okay, then applied to 5 people, from a long range, then add your regular auto attack damage to it, and you are dealing a shit load of damage to multiple people each hit, this is a lot of damage being dealt, and you can break twitch pushing his passives damage to high.

He is still going to melt tanks and squishy people regardless.

He does not metl tank (he get nothings in his kit to do, give a botr to ashe and she will be a better tank melter than twich), nor burst down squicky, faster than any other adc really...all he does than other dont is gettign aome AOE damage giving him great teamfight potential (but there so does jinx for exemple while still being more reliable).

but that is all so situational and team dependant than it make it not worth the pick for it.

pretty mcuh why he nned better duelling/laning presence. upgrading poison damage might be a good way to acheive it.

If. if you actually think Ashe with a {{item:3153}} melts tanks but Twitch with a {{item:3153}} then you just lost all credibility you had. And should really go play both champions and see how stupid what you just said is. 

I don't know if this even stems from a misunderstanding on the role of an ADC in general but you aren't suppose to burst tanks down, And a late game twitch with his passive stacked and his E is devastating to entire team. And you obviously play him very little or you would know that. He excels are long range AOE damage, his True damage DOES melt tanks better then most ADCs.

yea, but darius get Ad scaling on passive + damage on 3 of this ability.... consider instant 100% bonus ad atack with a slow, 315 + 105% aoe nuke and...oh yea...680 + 150% ad true damage finisher nuke with reet on kill....

that a whole different beast there. His passive dont NEED to be a significant part of his damage, he hurt so much withous it.


NOW twich get soem attack speed boost, a small slow....and a 290 + 150% ad bonus damage AFTER 4-6 attack...so yea...passive deserve to be stronger.

Physical damage on average is worth a bit more than half of true damage.  A Darius with about two AD items will do the same damage.

And, you know, Twitch's stacks go to his (magic?) damage E. Darius's go to his true damage ult.
Twitch deals no magical damage from his kit. If it comes from anywhere, it's from allied buffs and his Cutlass active.
Gotcha. Thanks for confirming, I was thinking it was Magic because it's sort of a magic effect and some other older ADCs have random magic damage abilities.

Don't be silly, %Health true damage was a *ridiculously* silly idea to begin with. There is literally no way to counter it besides building *more damage than a Marksman/Assassin,* and when you're playing champions like Sejuani, Amumu, Cho'Gath, Zac or Nautilus, that's not exactly a viable choice.

no way to counter it? you can just get radiun/frozen heart...slow her attack speed most you can, as the damage only prom once every 3 attack...you can kill her like 5 time before she proc that 8% true damage enought time to kill you. vayne nowhere that uncounterable.


Kog'maw % based is actually much more potent than vayne is. might not be true damage but magical, but by the time vayne proc a 8% true damage, he proc 24% magic damage. even with soem magic resist most likely hurt you more

Well, that's not really countering the true damage itself, is it? It's countering the entirety of what an ADC does. Unless it's Graves, but he's a special case. I AM glad it's only once per 3 AA, and only 8%, but had it been any more than that, Vayne would be *broken god-damn OP.* I don't really think it's *broken,* just... Incredibly obnoxious to deal with. And a bit silly.

Oh, and... As for Kog Maw, yes. He can proc it more often and will deal more %Health damage than Vayne. But his is an active ability with a CD, not to mention it costs mana. Vayne's is entirely passive, and she's got hard-cc as well. ... And you got the numbers wrong, by the time Vayne does 8%, Kog does 18%. Not trying to be rude or anything, I just want the numbers to be correct.

On the thread topic though, which I realize I haven't said anything about yet (sorry about that,) I agree twitch's poison might need a tiny buff. I just don't want it to be %Health, as that would be *very* toxic, and, ironically, no one wants that. Although, it *could* work to *indirectly* buff Twitch's poison by buffing his E... Or just making his E have no cast time. That'd definitely help him a *lot.*
actually kog maw bio barrage have no mana cost, and it last 8 second out of a 17 second cooldown...pretty much up all the time you will fight him...
Vayne with Madred's Bloodrazor and decent AS was obscene.
And perhaps most importantly, if you get on Koggy Woggles you kill him. Vayne is a slippery bitch.

[Approximately 13% of his damage output is True.](http://champion.gg/champion/Twitch) On average, he deals about twice the true damage that Corki does.

Back in 4.10, they nerfed his passive, and essentially reverted it in 5.7.

I don't think buffing his passive any more is at all a good idea. Maybe improving his ~~Expunge~~ Contaminate will give him more reliability, since reverting anything they did to his stealth feels like a horrible mistake.

But corki have much more damage overall in the rest of his kit.

-have long range spammable poke, allow trinity force spam
-have aoe nuke
-have leap with DOT
-have armor sherring DOT

Where twich get a 30 or so bonus damage when he ult, that lauchable 36 true damage per second and a decent damage contaminate but nothinsg flashy where either.

Corki is mostly an early/mid game champ due to his poke and burst, while Twitch is one of the best hypercarries that focuses on DPS and all-ins.

The difference in their damage outputs means Twitch is better at getting key picks and is better at dealing with forced teamfights. Corki's escape will only let him survive for as long as people can't kill him before CC wears off.

These essential differences in their playstyles makes it very difficult to compare the two.

If anything, I would like Twitch's Contaminate casting to be more fluid and feel easier to use.

Twitch poison is in an OK state right now. Not overwhelming, but a decent true damage dot on everyone that stacks up over the course of a fight.

Twitch has other problems.

If he takes ANY DAMAGE while charging his q, it takes 6 seconds to go off, at which point there is not point to the skill.

His W is not even a damaging spell, and the cc is mediocre at best.

His R, though it is a very good buff, makes it possible to dodge his basic attacks, and makes orb-walking difficult on  an immobile champion.
